Detailed Description

Resource management for PKI resources.

Function Documentation

void __cvmx_pki_global_rsrc_free ( int  node  ) 

This function frees all the PKI software resources (clusters, styles, qpg_entry, pcam_entry etc) for the specified node.

int cvmx_pki_bpid_alloc ( int  node,
int  bpid 
)

This function allocates/reserves a bpid from pool of global bpid per node.

Parameters:
node node to allocate bpid from.
bpid bpid to allocate, if -1 it will be allocated first available boid from bpid resource. If index is positive number and in range, it will try to allocate specified bpid.
Returns:
bpid number on success, -1 on alloc failure. -2 on resource already reserved.
int cvmx_pki_bpid_free ( int  node,
int  bpid 
)

This function frees a bpid from pool of global bpid per node.

Parameters:
node node to free bpid from.
bpid bpid to free
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure or
int cvmx_pki_cluster_alloc ( int  node,
int  num_clusters,
uint64_t *  cluster_mask 
)

This function allocates/reserves a cluster from per node cluster resources.

Parameters:
node node to allocate cluster group from.
cluster_mask mask of clusters to allocate/reserve, if -1 , allocate any available clusters.
num_clusters number of clusters that will be allocated
int cvmx_pki_cluster_free ( int  node,
uint64_t  cluster_mask 
)

This function frees clusters from per node clusters resources.

Parameters:
node node to free clusters from.
cluster_mask mask of clusters need freeing
Returns:
0 on success or -1 on failure

int  cl_grp

This function allocates/reserves a cluster group from per node cluster group resources.

Parameters:
node node to allocate cluster group from.
cl_grp cluster group to allocate/reserve, if -1 , allocate any available cluster group.
Returns:
cluster group number or -1 on failure
Parameters:
node node to allocate cluster group from.
cl_grp cluster group to allocate/reserve, if -1 , allocate any available cluster group.
Returns:
cluster group number -1 on alloc failure. -2 on resource already reserved.

cl_grp cluster group to free

0 on success or -1 on failure

Returns:
0 on success -1 on alloc failure. -2 on resource already reserved.
int cvmx_pki_mtag_idx_alloc ( int  node,
int  idx 
)

This function frees all the PKI software resources (clusters, styles, qpg_entry, pcam_entry etc) for the specified node.

This function allocates/reserves an index from pool of global MTAG-IDX per node.

Parameters:
node node to allocate index from.
idx index to allocate, if -1 it will be allocated
Returns:
MTAG index number on success, -1 on alloc failure. -2 on resource already reserved.

Returns:

int cvmx_pki_pcam_entry_alloc ( int  node,
int  index,
int  bank,
uint64_t  cluster_mask 
)

This function allocates/reserves a pcam entry from node.

Parameters:
node node to allocate pcam entry from.
index index of pacm entry (0-191), if -1 , allocate any available pcam entry.
bank pcam bank where to allocate/reserve pcan entry from
cluster_mask mask of clusters from which pcam entry is needed.
Returns:
pcam entry of -1 on failure
int cvmx_pki_pcam_entry_free ( int  node,
int  index,
int  bank,
uint64_t  cluster_mask 
)

This function frees a pcam entry from node.

Parameters:
node node to allocate pcam entry from.
index index of pacm entry (0-191) needs to be freed.
bank pcam bank where to free pcam entry from
cluster_mask mask of clusters from which pcam entry is freed.
Returns:
0 on success OR -1 on failure
int cvmx_pki_qpg_entry_alloc ( int  node,
int  base_offset,
int  count 
)

This function allocates/reserves QPG table entries per node.

Parameters:
node node number.
base_offset base_offset in qpg table. If -1, first available qpg base_offset will be allocated. If base_offset is positive number and in range, it will try to allocate specified base_offset.
count number of consecutive qpg entries to allocate. They will be consecutive from base offset.
Returns:
qpg table base offset number on success, -1 on failure.
Parameters:
node node number.
base_offset base_offset in qpg table. If -1, first available qpg base_offset will be allocated. If base_offset is positive number and in range, it will try to allocate specified base_offset.
count number of consecutive qpg entries to allocate. They will be consecutive from base offset.
Returns:
qpg table base offset number on success -1 on alloc failure. -2 on resource already reserved.
int cvmx_pki_qpg_entry_free ( int  node,
int  base_offset,
int  count 
)

This function frees QPG table entries per node.

Parameters:
node node number.
base_offset base_offset in qpg table. If -1, first available qpg base_offset will be allocated. If base_offset is positive number and in range, it will try to allocate specified base_offset.
count number of consecutive qpg entries to allocate. They will be consecutive from base offset.
Returns:
qpg table base offset number on success, -1 on failure.
int cvmx_pki_style_alloc ( int  node,
int  style 
)

This function allocates/reserves a style from pool of global styles per node.

Parameters:
node node to allocate style from.
style style to allocate, if -1 it will be allocated first available style from style resource. If index is positive number and in range, it will try to allocate specified style.
Returns:
style number on success, -1 on failure.
Parameters:
node node to allocate style from.
style style to allocate, if -1 it will be allocated first available style from style resource. If index is positive number and in range, it will try to allocate specified style.
Returns:
style number on success, -1 on alloc failure. -2 on resource already reserved.
int cvmx_pki_style_free ( int  node,
int  style 
)

This function frees a style from pool of global styles per node.

Parameters:
node node to free style from.
style style to free
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure.
Parameters:
node node to free style from.
style style to free
Returns:
0 on success, -1 on failure or if the style is shared a positive count of remaining users for this style.
